Answer: To get the database id of the item that is clicked on your ListView, you can modify your onItemClick method in your MainActivity to look like this:

```java
mylist.setOnItemClickListener(new AdapterView.OnItemClickListener() {
    @Override
    public void onItemClick(AdapterView<?> parent, View view, int position, long id) {
        Cursor cursor = (Cursor) mylist.getItemAtPosition(position);
        long itemId = cursor.getLong(cursor.getColumnIndex(COLUMN_ID));
        Log.d("Clicked item id", " "+itemId);
    }
});
```

In this code, `mylist.getItemAtPosition(position)` returns a Cursor object that represents the item at the specified position in the ListView. Then, `cursor.getLong(cursor.getColumnIndex(COLUMN_ID))` gets the value of the `COLUMN_ID` column in the Cursor, which is the id of the item in the database.

Please note that you need to ensure that the ListView is populated with data from the database before you can use the `getItemAtPosition` method. You can do this by calling the `getList` method in your `onCreate` method.

Also, please note that the `getItemAtPosition` method returns an Object, not a Cursor, so you need to cast the result to a Cursor before you can use the `getLong` method.
